title: Leather jacket
data:
**[English]()** • [中文（中国大陆）‎](/wiki/Leather_jacket/zh-CN "Leather jacket/zh-CN")

| \[   leather jacket   [![Leather jacket.png](/images/3/33/Leather_jacket.png)](/wiki/File:Leather_jacket.png) |                                             |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------- |
| Appearance                                                                                                    | leather jacket                              |
|                                                                                                               |                                             |
| Slot                                                                                                          | [body armor](/wiki/Body_armor "Body armor") |
| AC                                                                                                            | [1](/wiki/Armor_class "Armor class")        |
| Special                                                                                                       | *(none)*                                    |
|                                                                                                               |                                             |
| Base price                                                                                                    | 10 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")            |
| Weight                                                                                                        | [30](/wiki/Weight "Weight")                 |
| Material                                                                                                      | [leather](/wiki/Leather "Leather")          |

A **leather jacket** is a type of [body armor](/wiki/Body_armor "Body armor") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is naturally made of [leather](/wiki/Leather "Leather").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [5.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [5.3 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)
  - [5.4 EvilHack](#EvilHack)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

The [Archeologist](/wiki/Archeologist "Archeologist") starts each game with a +0 leather jacket.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

In addition to random generation, general [stores](/wiki/Store "Store"), used armor dealerships and antique weapon outlets can sell leather jackets.

[Students](/wiki/Student "Student"), [attendants](/wiki/Attendant "Attendant"), [abbots](/wiki/Abbot "Abbot"), [acolytes](/wiki/Acolyte "Acolyte"), [guides](/wiki/Guide "Guide"), and [apprentices](/wiki/Apprentice "Apprentice") have a 8⁄15 chance of [being generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a leather jacket;[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) [hunters](/wiki/Hunter "Hunter") have a 1⁄4 chance of being generated with a jacket;[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) and [thugs](/wiki/Thug "Thug") have a 1⁄2 chance of being generated with a jacket.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

## Description

While worn, the leather jacket grants 1 base [AC](/wiki/AC "AC").

## Strategy

The leather jacket is the weakest body armor available that grants base AC: though it is lightweight and does not interfere with [spellcasting](/wiki/Spellcasting "Spellcasting"), it should be replaced with better armor as soon as possible.

## History

The leather jacket first appears in [NetHack 3.1.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.0 "NetHack 3.1.0"). In prior versions, the Archeologist instead starts with +0 [leather armor](/wiki/Leather_armor "Leather armor").[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

## Variants

In variants with [object materials](/wiki/Object_materials "Object materials"), leather jackers may appear as simply **jackets**.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), the [Undead Slayer](/wiki/Undead_Slayer "Undead Slayer") has a 1⁄4 chance of starting with a +1 leather jacket.

[Upgrading](/wiki/Upgrading "Upgrading") a leather jacket will produce leather armor.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"), the jacket confers 0 base AC, 1 [DR](/wiki/DR "DR") and [MC2](/wiki/Magic_cancellation_\(3.4.3\) "Magic cancellation (3.4.3)") while worn, its weight is reduced to 20 [aum](/wiki/Aum "Aum"), and it always displays its material (including the default material).

The [Pirate](/wiki/Pirate "Pirate") role starts each game with a +0 leather jacket. [Mayor Cummerbund](/wiki/Mayor_Cummerbund "Mayor Cummerbund"), the Pirate [quest leader](/wiki/Quest_leader "Quest leader"), has a 1⁄3 chance of generating with a fireproof leather jacket; [skeletal pirates](/wiki/Skeletal_pirate "Skeletal pirate") may be generated with a rotted leather jacket.

The [Beastmaster's Duster](/index.php?title=Beastmaster%27s_Duster\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Beastmaster's Duster (page does not exist)") is an [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") jacket made of [dragonhide](/wiki/Dragonhide "Dragonhide").

### SlashTHEM

In addition to SLASH'EM details, [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") adds two artifact leather jackets: the Beastmaster's Duster, which acts as the [Zookeeper](/wiki/Zookeeper "Zookeeper")'s first [sacrifice gift](/wiki/Sacrifice_gift "Sacrifice gift"), and the [Full Metal Jacket](/index.php?title=Full_Metal_Jacket\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Full Metal Jacket (page does not exist)"). SlashTHEM also adds the Pirate role from dNetHack, and Mayor Cummerbund and skeletal pirates have the same odds of generating with leather jackets as in dNetHack.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), the [Infidel](/wiki/Infidel "Infidel") role starts each game with a cursed fireproof +1 leather jacket - [giant](/wiki/Giant_\(starting_race\) "Giant (starting race)") Infidels will instead start with a cursed fireproof +1 pair of [low boots](/wiki/Low_boots "Low boots").

[Cultists](/wiki/Cultist "Cultist") have a 8⁄15 chance of being generated with a leather jacket.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/u\_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 32](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/u_init.c#L32)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 281](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L281)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 306](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L306)
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 316](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L316)
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [u\_init.c in NetHack 3.0.0, line 103](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.0.0/u_init.c#line103 "Source:NetHack 3.0.0/u init.c")

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Leather jacket

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
English

 • 中文（中国大陆）‎
[   leather jacket  
Appearance leather jacket
Slot body armor
AC 1
Special (none)
Base price 10 zm
Weight 30
Material leather

A leather jacket is a type of body armor that appears in NetHack. It is naturally made of leather.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Description
  • 3 Strategy
  • 4 History
  • 5 Variants
    • 5.1 SLASH'EM
    • 5.2 dNetHack
    • 5.3 SlashTHEM
    • 5.4 EvilHack
  • 6 References

Generation

The Archeologist starts each game with a +0 leather jacket.[1]

In addition to random generation, general stores, used armor dealerships and antique weapon outlets can sell leather jackets.

Students, attendants, abbots, acolytes, guides, and apprentices have a 8⁄15 chance of being generated with a leather jacket;[2] hunters have a 1⁄4 chance of being generated with a jacket;[3] and thugs have a 1⁄2 chance of being generated with a jacket.[4]

Description

While worn, the leather jacket grants 1 base AC.

Strategy

The leather jacket is the weakest body armor available that grants base AC: though it is lightweight and does not interfere with spellcasting, it should be replaced with better armor as soon as possible.

History

The leather jacket first appears in NetHack 3.1.0. In prior versions, the Archeologist instead starts with +0 leather armor.[5]

Variants

In variants with object materials, leather jackers may appear as simply jackets.

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, the Undead Slayer has a 1⁄4 chance of starting with a +1 leather jacket.

Upgrading a leather jacket will produce leather armor.

dNetHack

In dNetHack, notdNetHack and notnotdNetHack, the jacket confers 0 base AC, 1 DR and MC2 while worn, its weight is reduced to 20 aum, and it always displays its material (including the default material).

The Pirate role starts each game with a +0 leather jacket. Mayor Cummerbund, the Pirate quest leader, has a 1⁄3 chance of generating with a fireproof leather jacket; skeletal pirates may be generated with a rotted leather jacket.

The Beastmaster's Duster is an artifact jacket made of dragonhide.

SlashTHEM

In addition to SLASH'EM details, SlashTHEM adds two artifact leather jackets: the Beastmaster's Duster, which acts as the Zookeeper's first sacrifice gift, and the Full Metal Jacket. SlashTHEM also adds the Pirate role from dNetHack, and Mayor Cummerbund and skeletal pirates have the same odds of generating with leather jackets as in dNetHack.

EvilHack

In EvilHack, the Infidel role starts each game with a cursed fireproof +1 leather jacket - giant Infidels will instead start with a cursed fireproof +1 pair of low boots.

Cultists have a 8⁄15 chance of being generated with a leather jacket.

References

  1. ↑ src/u_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 32
  2. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 281
  3. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 306
  4. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 316
  5. ↑ u_init.c in NetHack 3.0.0, line 103

A '''leather jacket''' is a type of [[body armor]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. It is naturally made of [[leather]].

==Generation==
The [[Archeologist]] starts each game with a +0 leather jacket.{{refsrc|src/u_init.c|32|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}

In addition to random generation, general [[store]]s, used armor dealerships and antique weapon outlets can sell leather jackets.

[[Student]]s, [[attendant]]s, [[abbot]]s, [[acolyte]]s, [[guide]]s, and [[apprentice]]s have a {{frac|8|15}} chance of [[Monster starting inventory|being generated with]] a leather jacket;{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|281|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} [[hunter]]s have a {{frac|4}} chance of being generated with a jacket;{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|306|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} and [[thug]]s have a {{frac|2}} chance of being generated with a jacket.{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|316|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}

==Description==
While worn, the leather jacket grants 1 base [[AC]].

==Strategy==
The leather jacket is the weakest body armor available that grants base AC: though it is lightweight and does not interfere with [[spellcasting]], it should be replaced with better armor as soon as possible.

==History==
The leather jacket first appears in [[NetHack 3.1.0]]. In prior versions, the Archeologist instead starts with +0 [[leather armor]].{{refsrc|u_init.c|103|nethack=3.0.0}}

==Variants==
In variants with [[object materials]], leather jackers may appear as simply '''jackets'''.

===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], the [[Undead Slayer]] has a {{frac|4}} chance of starting with a +1 leather jacket.

[[Upgrading]] a leather jacket will produce leather armor.

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], [[notdNetHack]] and [[notnotdNetHack]], the jacket confers 0 base AC, 1 [[DR]] and [[Magic cancellation (3.4.3)|MC2]] while worn, its weight is reduced to 20 [[aum]], and it always displays its material (including the default material).

The [[Pirate]] role starts each game with a +0 leather jacket. [[Mayor Cummerbund]], the Pirate [[quest leader]], has a {{frac|3}} chance of generating with a fireproof leather jacket; [[skeletal pirate]]s may be generated with a rotted leather jacket.

The [[Beastmaster's Duster]] is an [[artifact]] jacket made of [[dragonhide]].

===SlashTHEM===
In addition to SLASH'EM details, [[SlashTHEM]] adds two artifact leather jackets: the Beastmaster's Duster, which acts as the [[Zookeeper]]'s first [[sacrifice gift]], and the [[Full Metal Jacket]]. SlashTHEM also adds the Pirate role from dNetHack, and Mayor Cummerbund and skeletal pirates have the same odds of generating with leather jackets as in dNetHack.

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], the [[Infidel]] role starts each game with a cursed fireproof +1 leather jacket - [[Giant (starting race)|giant]] Infidels will instead start with a cursed fireproof +1 pair of [[low boots]].

[[Cultist]]s have a {{frac|8|15}} chance of being generated with a leather jacket.
